intro: Phacelia serrata, commonly known as the serrated phacelia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its hairy stems and serrated leaf margins. The plant produces small, blue to purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in open habitats such as meadows and rocky areas. Phacelia serrata is also valued as a nectar source for pollinators like bees and butterflies.
